text: John Webber (1841 - 12 March 1904) was an Australian politician. He was a member of the Queensland Legislative Council. == Early life == Webber was born in Kingsbrompton, Somerset, in 1841 to Thomas Webber and his wife Ann (née Burston). Webber married Henrietta Wells, in 1869 at Wanganella, New South Wales. == Politics == Webber was a member of the Bulloo Divisional Board, the Rabbit Board, and from May 1899 till his death a member of the Queensland Legislative Council. == Later life == Webber died on 12 March 1904 at St Helen's Private Hospital in Brisbane, following a long illness.., and was buried in Toowong Cemetery but later exhumed for burial in Thargomindah with his wife.Webber John -- Brisbane City Council Grave Location Search. Retrieved 15 March 2015. ==References== Category:Members of the Queensland Legislative Council Category:1841 births Category:1904 deaths Category:Burials at Toowong Cemetery Category:19th-century Australian politicians
title: John Webber (politician)
